name: Johnny Depp
description:
'''John Christopher Depp II''' (born June 9, 1963) is an American actor, musician, and filmmaker. He is the recipient of [[List of awards and nominations received by Johnny Depp|multiple accolades]], including a [[Golden Globe Award]] and a [[Screen Actors Guild Award]] as well as nominations for three [[Academy Awards]] and two [[British Academy Film Awards]]. [[Johnny Depp filmography|His films]], in which he has often played eccentric characters, have grossed over $10.8 billion worldwide.

Depp began his career as a musician performing in several amateur rock bands before making his feature film debut in the horror film ''[[A Nightmare on Elm Street]]'' (1984). He then acted in ''[[Platoon (film)|Platoon]]'' (1986) before rising to prominence as a [[teen idol]] on the television series ''[[21 Jump Street]]'' (1987–1990). Depp portrayed lead roles in ''[[Arizona Dream]]'' (1993), ''[[What's Eating Gilbert Grape]]'' (1993), ''[[Benny & Joon]]'' (1993), ''[[Dead Man]]'' (1995), ''[[Donnie Brasco (film)|Donnie Brasco]]'' (1997), ''[[Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (film)|Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas]]'' (1998), ''[[The Ninth Gate]]'' (1999), ''[[Chocolat (2000 film)|Chocolat]]'' (2000), and ''[[Blow (film)|Blow]]'' (2001). During this time, Depp became known for his work with director [[Tim Burton]], collaborating on eight films together, starting with ''[[Edward Scissorhands]]'' (1990), followed by ''[[Ed Wood (film)|Ed Wood]]'' (1994), ''[[Sleepy Hollow (film)|Sleepy Hollow]]'' (1999), ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (film)|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' (2005), ''[[Corpse Bride]]'' (2005), ''[[Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007 film)|Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street]]'' (2007), ''[[Alice in Wonderland (2010 film)|Alice in Wonderland]]'' (2010) and ''[[Dark Shadows (2012 film)|Dark Shadows]]'' (2012).

Depp gained worldwide stardom for his role as [[Jack Sparrow]] in the [[Pirates of the Caribbean (film series)|''Pirates of the Caribbean'' film series]] (2003–2017). He earned three nominations for the [[Academy Award for Best Actor]] for his roles as Jack Sparrow in ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl]]'' (2003), [[J. M. Barrie]] in ''[[Finding Neverland (film)|Finding Neverland]]'' (2004), and the [[Sweeney Todd|title role]] in ''[[Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007 film)|Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street]]'' (2007). His other well-received films include ''[[Public Enemies (2009 film)|Public Enemies]]'' (2009), ''[[Rango (2011 film)|Rango]]'' (2011), ''[[Into the Woods (film)|Into the Woods]]'' (2014), ''[[Black Mass (film)|Black Mass]]'' (2015), ''[[Murder on the Orient Express (2017 film)|Murder on the Orient Express]]'' (2017) and ''[[Minamata (film)|Minamata]]'' (2020). He portrayed [[Gellert Grindelwald]] in two films within the [[Wizarding World]]'s [[Fantastic Beasts|''Fantastic Beasts'' films]] in [[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|2016]] and [[Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald|2018]].

For his work in the film industry, he received an [[Honorary César]] and star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in 1999. He was named ''People's'' [[Sexiest Man Alive]] twice, in 2003 and in 2009. Outside acting, Depp has produced films through his company [[Infinitum Nihil]], which he founded in 2004. He also formed the rock [[Supergroup (music)|supergroup]] [[Hollywood Vampires (band)|Hollywood Vampires]] with [[Alice Cooper]] and [[Joe Perry (musician)|Joe Perry]]. 

In 2022, Depp won [[Depp v. Heard|a defamation case]] against his ex-wife, [[Amber Heard]], with the jury awarding him $15 million{{efn|The jury awarded Depp $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages,<ref name="CNverdict" /><ref name="APverdict" /> although the punitive damages were reduced to $350,000 due to a limit imposed by a Virginia state law.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chappell |first1=Bill |last2=Diaz |first2=Jaclyn |title=Depp is awarded more than $10M in defamation case against Heard and she gets $2M |url=https://www.npr.org/2022/06/01/1102118755/depp-heard-trial-verdict |access-date=June 2, 2022 |work=[[NPR]] |date=June 1, 2022 |archive-date=June 1, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220601231157/https://www.npr.org/2022/06/01/1102118755/depp-heard-trial-verdict |url-status=live }}</ref>}} and Heard $2 million in her countersuit. The highly publicized case sparked widespread debate on defamation, [[domestic abuse]], and [[Violence against men|male victims of domestic violence]].
